data.title: How Did Robin Williams Shaped American Culture - 1889 Words
data.meta_description: Free Essay: Juliane Baur US-History Period 3 Rough Draft Robin McLaurin Williams was a remarkable person who shaped the american culture as an actor and...
data.text:
Juliane Baur

US-History

Period 3

Rough Draft

Robin McLaurin Williams was a remarkable person who shaped the american culture as an actor and comedian. A lot of people see him as an idol. He was born on 21st July 1951 in Chicago, Ilinois. He grew up in wealthy conditions as the only child of Laura McLaurin, a founder of a modeling agency and Robert Fitzgerald who was a senior employee at Ford. He spent most of his childhood in different places due to his father's profession before the family finally settled in Marin County.

Robin Williams was bullied badly during his childhood for being chubby. Therefore he spent a lot of his time playing alone in the family's large home to avoid his tormentors. Eventually, he conquered his overweight label by joining the wrestling and tracks teams. That’s when he realised that he could make the other children laugh as a way of gaining respect from them.

His father took early retirement when Robin Williams was 16. That is when they moved to California where he finished his education at Redwood High School. Up to this point, he had already been noticed for his flair in entertaining people, a natural talent.

After graduation in 1969, Robin Williams attended Claremont Men's College to learn more about acting. Later in life it turned out to be the right decision. He ended up taking lessons in improvisation, which seemed to …show more content…

In which you can so many great movies that will always be watched over and over again. One of his latest films is for example “Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb” which is also due in theaters in December 2014. Robin Williams also has an remakable list of television credits . He took for example place in “Law & Order: SVU” and “Homicide: Life on the Streets.” In 2013 he returned back to TV in a starring role opposite Sarah Michelle Gellar in the critically-acclaimed sitcom “The Crazy Ones.” Unfortunately, there was only one season of this
